tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 担（たん、元の用字は擔）は、中国の尺貫法（尺斤法。市制 (単位系)・台制）の重量（質量）の物理単位である。
sen.e: Tan (the letter 擔 was used in Yuan) was a unit of weight (mass) under Chinese shakkanho (the system of measuring length by the shaku and weight by the kan) (shakusekiho. shisei (tanikei), daisei).
sen.cmt: （尺斤法。市制 (単位系)・台制）→読み、定訳不明
sen.e: Tan (the letter 擔 was used in Yuan) was a unit of weight (mass) under the Chinese shakkanho (the system of measuring length by the shaku and weight by the kan) (shakusekiho, Chinese traditional system of measurement [unit system], Taiwanese traditional system of measurement).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。尺貫法のカッコ内を修正しました。カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。「尺斤法」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: Tan (the letter 擔 was used in Yuan) was a unit of weight (mass) under the Chinese shakkanho (the system of measuring length by the shaku and weight by the kan) (shakusekiho, Chinese traditional system of measurement [unit system], Taiwanese traditional system of measurement).

sen.j: 元々の担は、人夫1人が一度に運べる（担げる）重量として定義されたものである。
sen.e: Tan was originally defined as the weight which a single porter can bring (shoulder) at one time.
Tan was originally defined as the weight which a single laborer could carry (to shoulder) at one time.
sen.cmt: porter→laborer, can→could,bring (shoulder)→carry (to shoulder) と修正しました。
sen.e: Tan was originally defined as the weight which a single laborer could carry (to shoulder) at one time.

sen.j: 現在では、1担は100斤と定義されており、中国大陸ではちょうど50 キログラム、香港では60.478982 kg、台湾ではちょうど60 kgとなる。
sen.e: Currently one tan is defined as 100 kin, and it is equivalent to 50 kg in the Mainland China, 60.478982 kg in Hong Kong and 60kg in Taiwan respectively.
Currently one tan is defined as 100 kin, and it is equivalent to exactly 50 kg in the mainland China, 60.478982 kg in Hong Kong and exactly 60 kg in Taiwan respectively.
sen.cmt: exactly を補いました。Mainland→mainland, スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Currently one tan is defined as 100 kin, and it is equivalent to exactly 50 kg in the mainland China, 60.478982 kg in Hong Kong and exactly 60 kg in Taiwan respectively.

sen.j: 元は慣習的な単位であったが、清代に外国との貿易のために各国と単位についての協定を結び、公式の単位となった。
sen.e: It was a unit of weight customarily used in the era of Yuan, but it became the official one in the era of Qing when the Qing dynasty concluded the treaty on units with foreign countries for the purpose of foreign trade.
It was originally a conventional unit, but it became the official one in the era of Qing when the Qing dynasty concluded the treaty on units with foreign countries for the purpose of foreign trade.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: It was originally a conventional unit, but it became the official one in the era of Qing when the Qing dynasty concluded the treaty on units with foreign countries for the purpose of foreign trade.

sen.j: 現在香港で使われている担はこの定義に由来するものである。
sen.e: Tan which is being used in Hong Kong today derived from the above definition.

sen.j: 香港の担は英語でpiculと呼ばれ、同じ単位が東南アジア一帯でも使用されている。
sen.e: Hong Kong's tan is called picul in English, and the same unit is being used in the South-East Asia region.
Hong Kong's tan is called picul in English, and the same unit is used in the Southeast Asia region.
sen.cmt: being を削除しました。South-East→Southeast と修正しました。
sen.e: Hong Kong's tan is called picul in English, and the same unit is used in the Southeast Asia region.

sen.j: 中国大陸では1斤＝500グラムと定められたため、1担＝50キログラムとなる。
sen.e: AS one (1) kin was determined equivalent to 500 g in the mainland China, one (1) tan is equivalent to 50 kg.
AS one kin was determined equivalent to 500 g in the mainland China, one tan is equivalent to 50 kg.
AS one kin was determined equivalent to 500 g in the mainland China, one tan is equivalent to 50 kg.

sen.j: 台湾では、日本統治時代 (台湾)があったために日本の尺貫法の影響を受けて1斤＝600グラムとなり、1担＝60キログラムとなった。
sen.e: One (1) kin is equivalent to 600 g and one (1) tan is equivalent to 60 kg in Taiwan because its measuring system was affected by the Japanese shakkanho during the era of Japanese rule (Taiwan).
One kin came to equivalent to 600 g and one tan came to equivalent to 60 kg in Taiwan, because its measuring system was affected by the Japanese shakkanho during the Period of Japanese Rule (Taiwan).
sen.cmt: (1)を削除しました。カンマを補いました。is→came to と修正しました。「日本統治時代」は用語集を参照しましたが、"Period of Japanese Rule"との記述がウェブ上で多く見られる為そのようにしました。
sen.e: One kin came to equivalent to 600 g and one tan came to equivalent to 60 kg in Taiwan, because its measuring system was affected by the Japanese shakkanho during the Period of Japanese Rule (Taiwan).
